Package thing.dna

Class C_ChromosomePair

  • java.lang.Object
    • thing.dna.C_ChromosomePair
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_ConstantNumeric, I_DnaThing, I_MappedDna
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    C_XsomePairMicrosat, C_XsomePairSexual
    public class C_ChromosomePair
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_MappedDna, I_ConstantNumeric
    A Chromosome pair is just two chromosomes of a diploid genome.

    NOTE: map locations are currently not checked for sequential ordering, so each new Gene that is added must be at a higher map location than all of the previously added Genes.

    Author:
    kyle wagner, elyk@acm.org / JLF 2010 - was formerly class diploidGenome Version 1.1, Aug 28, 2002 / 01.2012

    • Constructor Detail

      • C_ChromosomePair

        public C_ChromosomePair​(int numGenes,
                        I_Recombinator recombinator)
        Parameters:
        recombinator - the Recombinator works for HaploidGenomes only, but since the DiploidGenome is just 2 haploids, the recombinator is appropriate - it operates on the 2 haploid strands.

      • C_ChromosomePair

        public C_ChromosomePair​(double mapLength,
                        int numGenes,
                        I_Recombinator recombinator)
        Parameters:
        mapLength - the length of this chromosome pair in map units
        numGenes - how many genes will be in ont strand of the final chromosome pair (only for efficiency - if count is incorrect, genome will still function properly, it will simply take a longer time to construct).
        recombinator - the Recombinator works for HaploidGenomes only, but since the DiploidGenome is just 2 haploids, the recombinator is appropriate - it operates on the 2 haploid strands.

      • C_ChromosomePair

                        C_Chromosome rightXtid)
        Used for replication, etc.

      • numGenes

        public int numGenes()

      • mutate

        public void mutate​(java.lang.Object info)
        Potentially modify all of the Genes (or components) of this Genetic object. Mutate both strands according to how HaploidGenome's mutate() works. Variation may be constrained by a rate (a mutation rate), or other information provided in the argument, info.
        Specified by:
        mutate in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        info - An optional argument (can be null). Often this will be a Double representing a mutation rate.

                              int endLocus)
        Description copied from interface: I_DnaThing
        Creates a new Genetic object which is copied from startLocus (inclusive) to endLocus (exclusive) in genome.
        Specified by:
        copySegment in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        startLocus - the locus where the duplication of genome will begin
        endLocus - the locus where duplication ends (exlcusive)

      • replicate

        public I_DnaThing replicate​(java.lang.Object info)
        The replicated individual does not have to be asexual, but is most likely to have this property.
        Specified by:
        replicate in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        info - Possibly a mutation rate, or other information needed in order to perform the replication.
        Returns:
        a new Genetic object, a duplicate of this one. Mutations might have occured, however.

      • mate

        public I_DnaThing mate​(java.lang.Object info,
                       I_DnaThing parent2)
        The replicated individual does not have to be bisexual, but is most likely to have this property.
        Parameters:
        info - Possibly a mutation rate, or other information needed in order to perform the mating.
        parent2 - the other individual involved in this mating.
        Returns:
        a new Genetic object, a combination of the two parents.. Mutations might have occurred, however.

        public I_MappedDna crossover()

      • crossover

        public I_DnaThing crossover​(I_DnaThing parent2)
        Description copied from interface: I_DnaThing
        Takes this Genetic object and mixes it up with another genetic object, producing a third Genetic object. The usual case is to take 2 haploid genomes and create a third haploid consisting of various genes taken from each of the parents. Neither parent is modified in the process.
        Specified by:
        crossover in interface I_DnaThing
        Parameters:
        parent2 - Another Genetic object with which to mix components (genes or other parts).
